Class PlayerList

java.lang.Object
  java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      java.util.AbstractList<E>
          java.util.ArrayList<Player>
              battlesys.PlayerList
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<Player>, java.util.Collection<Player>, java.util.List<Player>, java.util.RandomAccess
public class PlayerList
extends java.util.ArrayList<Player>

A List of Players, with numerous more functions specific for a list of players

See Also:

playerSubset

public final PlayerList playerSubset(int n)
get a subset of players. It returns a swallow copy of the players. If the size of player is less than n, a swallow copy of original player is returned.

Parameters:
n - How many player to pick
Returns:
The picked players
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If n < 0

livingPlayer

public final PlayerList livingPlayer()
Given a whole list of player, return a new list of player whose are living (hp > 0)

Returns:
reference to new array

Count the number of living players in an array of player

Returns:
Number of living players

randomPick

public final Player randomPick()
randomly pick a player from this list of players that is living. If no such player a player is randomly picked.

Returns:

randomPick

public final Player randomPick(boolean giveNull)
Randomly pick a player from this list of players that is living

Parameters:
giveNull - Whether null should be given if no such player. If false, a random player will be given
Returns:

invokeForPlayers

public final java.lang.Object[] invokeForPlayers(java.lang.String methodName,
                                                 java.lang.Class[] argType,
                                                 java.lang.Object[] args,
                                                 boolean liveOnly)
Invoke a particular function for all the team members in this list, including the player itself

Parameters:
methodName - The name of the function to be invoked.
argType - Types of the arguments of the function to be invoked.
args - Arguments to be sent into the function invoked.
liveOnly - If true only players with HP greater than zero are considered
Returns:
Array of objects each function call by each player returns.
It is guaranteed that the position of objects always correspond to the position of players as in the array

getPlayerOfMinQuality

public final Player getPlayerOfMinQuality(java.lang.String quality,
                                          boolean liveOnly,
                                          boolean minimal)
Find the player with the extreme value of given quality. If no such player exists a random player from pList is returned. If more than one have the same extreme value, the smaller index one will returned.

Parameters:
quality - The quantity requested, either HP, Atk, Def, Spd, Mor, specified in String form
liveOnly - Whether only Players living are searched
minimal - Whether the minimal or the maximal of the quality should be returned, if true, minimal will be returned, otherwise maximal will be returned
Returns:
Player

getStatusInflictedPlayer

public final Player getStatusInflictedPlayer(int statusId)
Return the player who have a certain status inflicted. If more than one is in such status anyone of them is returned. If there is no such player then null is returned. Only players living are concerned

Parameters:
statusId - The id of the status concerned
Returns:
the player data who have a certain status inflicted. If no such player null is returned.

getStatusInflictedPlayer

public final Player getStatusInflictedPlayer(int statusId,
                                             boolean not)
Return the player who have a certain status inflicted. If more than one is in such status anyone of them is selected. If there is no such player then null is returned. Only players living are concerned

Parameters:
statusId - The id of the status concerned
not - Whether the opposite, that is, players not inflicted, should be returned.
Returns:
player data who have a certain status inflicted. If no such player null is returned.

getStatusInflictedPlayer

public final Player getStatusInflictedPlayer(int statusId,
                                             boolean not,
                                             java.lang.String quality,
                                             boolean minimal)
Return the player who have a certain status inflicted. If more than one is in such status the one with minimal quality is returned. If there is no such player then null is returned. Only players living are concerned

Parameters:
statusId - The id of the status concerned
not - Whether the opposite, that is, players not inflicted, should be returned.
quality - The quality concerned. either HP, Atk, Def, Spd, Mor, specified in String form. Caps sensitive
minimal - Whether the minimal or the maximal of the quality should be returned
Returns:
player data who have a certain status inflicted. If no such player null is returned

nameList

public final java.lang.String nameList()
Return list of names from a list of player

Returns:
list of names from a list of player, full-sized stroke delimited

findPlayer

public final Player findPlayer(java.lang.String name)
Search a player by a name from a list, and return the object reference to this player object

Parameters:
name - Name of the player to be found
Returns:
object reference to the player given by the name, null is returned if search failed

allDead

public final boolean allDead()
Return whether all players in this player's team have 0 or below HP

Returns:
true if all players have neg HP ("dead"), false otherwise

statusInflicted

public final boolean statusInflicted(int statusId)
If anyone in this list of player have a certain status inflicted

Parameters:
statusId - statusId ID of status to test, i.e. statusId.POISON.getId(), statusId.PIN.getId(), etc...
Returns:
